channel.title: Hack a school comp
channel.description:
Hey guys, ive hacked my school comp a little bit, ive got into registry, nearlly got into the control pannel aswell!
now i need some help so i canget admin priviligis! (I'm not bortherd about getting told off because it's my last year ^^)
And by the way, they have blocked making .bat files, but i no a way around that. So any ideas would be grateful :)

item.title: Hack a school comp
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

I think it’s quite stupid to do it anyways. I mean, they give you the opportunity to use the computers, and then you go fuck em up. Just tell the IT guy that there are some bugs in the system, so he can fix it.

Read full topic

item.title: Hack a school comp
item.dc:creator: @johno2 johno2
item.description:
@johno2 wrote:

Lol? it is classed as “hacking” because you got somewhere on a school comp where ur not ment 2… anyway it doesn’t matter ne more, i changed a limited account into admin by usin cmd

Read full topic

now i need some help so i canget admin priviligis! (I’m not bortherd about getting told off because it’s my last year ^^)

And by the way, they have blocked making .bat files, but i no a way around that. So any ideas would be grateful :)[/quote]
loool you didn’t hack shit.

You can’t hack…so don’t think your mr.Macho man…

item.title: Hack a school comp
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

[quote=“johno2, post:1, topic:230636”]Hey guys, ive hacked my school comp a little bit, ive got into registry, nearlly got into the control pannel aswell!

now i need some help so i canget admin priviligis! (I’m not bortherd about getting told off because it’s my last year ^^)

And by the way, they have blocked making .bat files, but i no a way around that. So any ideas would be grateful :)[/quote]

The correct term for what you are doing is cracking, not hacking. Just google ‘creating an admin account using batch’, wich probably won’t work if you have decent IT guys at your school.

Read full topic
